points.digest:
For a long time I doubted about the vaccinations from Hib and pneumococcus, because these diseases can really be dangerous.The fact that I personally put the final cross on these vaccinations was the following article published in a rather marginal journal specializing in hypotheses It seems that even for this marginal magazine, the article was too marginal, and accompanied by an [editorial==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21907498] article in which they write that, despite , that the theme of the connection between vaccines and autism is already worn to holes and a denial bent, and that although the author of the article is not a scientist at all, his hypothesis is, nevertheless, quite plausible, and it should be checked.

I highly recommend reading this article in full.
Editorial article is also worth reading.
Conjugated vaccines radically change immunological response to carbohydrate antigens In the absence of a conjugated vaccine, carbohydrate antigens usually do not induce an immune response of T cells, but induce a weaker response (T-cell independent). This is due to the fact that B2 cells do not synthesize antibodies without the signal of T-helper cells. In order for this to happen, the B2-cell, and its related T-helper cell, should recognize the same, or similar [epitope==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epitope]. But since T cells recognize only protein epitopes, T helper cells are usually able to activate B2 cells in response to protein antigens. In response to bacterial capsular polysaccharides, the immune system forms a response through cells B1 and MZB (Marginal zone B). B1 cells do not begin to react to bacterial carbohydrate antigens until 18-24 months, and their response does not fully mature until about 5 years of age. Therefore, infants and young children are unable to respond effectively to capsular bacteria. Conjugated vaccines use the fact that B2 cells and their related T helper cells do not have to respond to an identical epitope, but rather recognize closely related epitopes. Although the mechanisms by which conjugate vaccines work are not fully understood, it is believed that [antigen-presenting cells==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antigen-presenting_cell], treat the combined protein carrier and carbohydrate [hapten==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hapten], which leads to recognition of the protein carrier by T-helper cells, and recognition of carbohydrate antigens by B2 cells. That is, conjugated vaccines change the immunological response to carbohydrate antigens in infants and young children, from a hypo-sensitive to a full T cell response.
Because antibodies against carbohydrate antigens are often autoreactive with their own carbohydrates, the differentiation of B cells to B2 cells can lead to an autoimmune reaction. Therefore, B cells against carbohydrate antigens are carefully regulated by the immune system. Antibodies to native carbohydrates are associated with several autoimmune diseases, such as systemic lupus erythematosus, myocarditis and rheumatic heart disease, Sydenham's chorea, and children's autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders associated with Streptococcal infections (PANDAS).
Unlike antibodies produced by B2 cells, antibodies produced by B1 and MZB cells are short-lived and [low-affinity==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligand_(biochemistry)], and conducted to an autoimmune reaction with
Autism has an increased level of antibodies to nervous structures and an increased level of proinflammatory cytokines in the brain, which indicates that autoimmune and neuroinflammatory processes can play a role in some cases of autism.
Because [myelinization==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myelin] (the formation of an insulating nerve fibers) is most intense during the first 9 months of life, and continues in early childhood, neuronal development in infants and young children can be particularly vulnerable to self-reactive antibodies, including those that react with glycoproteins in myelin sheaths.

The first conjugate vaccine (from Hib) appeared in the US in 1988, and was later licensed in most other developed countries, including Denmark in 1993, and Izr ail, where it was licensed in 1992, and introduced into the national vaccination calendar in 1994.
The incidence of autism began to rise dramatically in the US since births in the middle of 1987. In Denmark and Israel, the jump in autism began about 5 years later.
In 1990, the vaccine was licensed to infants from the age of two months, which may explain the further increase in autism.Another explanation for the increase in autism in the mid-90s could be a change in the protein carrier used in the vaccine, which made her more immune gene. If the Hib vaccine is an autism trigger, then an increase in its immunogenicity and a change in the [binding site==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binding_site] may increase the likelihood of autism.
The licensing of the pneumococcal vaccine in 2000 may partially explain the further increase in autism. Children born in 1995 were the first to be vaccinated against pneumococcus, and this is consistent with CDC data, according to which the level of autism in 1992-1994 did not change, and in 1998 autism was already 57% higher than in 1994, m.
In Denmark, the Hib vaccine was licensed in 1993, but immediately followed by an aggressive vaccination campaign for children, starting in 1988, which coincides with the growth of autism among those born in 1988 and later. > In Israel, the number of children receiving disability benefits due to autism did not change from 1972 to 1995. But from 1996 to 1998, their number increased 5-fold, which is explained by this hypothesis. In 2004, 11% of the beneficiaries were born in 1985-89 (before vaccine licensing), 21.1% were born in 1990-94 (the beginning of vaccination), and 37% were born in 1995-99 (immediately after the vaccination was introduced National calendar). The immune system in response to the carbohydrate membrane of capsular bacteria produces antibodies through B1 and MZB cells in adults, and in children older than 5 years. But children under 5 years of age react poorly to carbohydrate antigens. Conjugated vaccines consist of a protein carrier attached to a carbohydrate antigen, and are able to circumvent this restriction of the immune system to carbohydrate antigens in children. Due to the protein carrier, these vaccines can induce the production of antibodies by B2 cells.
The development of antibodies to carbohydrate antigens via B2 cells is a significant departure from the natural paradigm in which B1 and MZB cells usually produce short-lived antibodies against carbohydrate antigens, and B2 cells produce more long-living against protein antigens. In addition to the fact that the immune system of children under 5 years of age reacts poorly to capsular bacteria, the maternal IgM and IgG2 antibodies do not pass well the placenta, from which it follows that the embryos are probably also not protected from capsular bacteria. From the point of view of evolution, this is quite unexpected. It is possible that this evolutionary flaw is accompanied by a compensatory evolutionary advantage. One possible explanation is that antibodies to carbohydrate antigens can be cross-reactive with neuronal glycoproteins, and a fine balance has been achieved, by evolution, between evolutionary protection against capsular bacteria and the need for development of the nervous system. This is consistent with the fact that myelination begins with infancy, and lasts until early childhood, which coincides with the period during which the immune system is hypo-sensitive to carbohydrate antigens. Moreover, the period during which the immune system is least sensitive to carbohydrate antigens corresponds to the period of the most intense myelination. It is possible that antibodies to carbohydrates not only interfere with the development of the nervous system in infants and young children, but their negative effects are strengthened by a stable a response of the immune system induced by conjugated vaccines, which significantly disturbs the balance achieved by evolution.

epigraph.text: I've never had a flu shot, and I've never had the flu. I don't like the idea of injecting bad stuff into your body, which is basically what they do.

points.digest: It is believed that more people die from the flu than from all the other vaccine diseases combined. Therefore, theoretically, if there is a sense from something to get vaccinated, it's from the flu.

Influenza viruses are divided into three types A, B and C. Type A is divided into subtypes according to the antigens of hemagglutinin (H) and neuraminidase (N).There are 18 hemagglutinin antigens and 9 neuraminidase antigens, but for humans, mainly types of hemagglutinin H1, H2 and H3 (which attach to cells) and types of neuraminidase N1 and N2 (which penetrate the cell).
Type C virus does not cause epidemics, most cases are subclinical, and it is not contained in the vaccine. Type B virus usually leads to a milder disease than type A.
A vaccine usually with holds one strain of each of the three types of the virus: A(H1N1), A(H3N2) and B.
Since 2013, tetravalent vaccines are available that include an additional strain of the type B virus. Since 2003, live nasal vaccines.
Vaccines of the season 2017/18 [contain==https://www.cdc.gov/flu/professionals/acip/index.htm] the following strains: A/Hong Kong/4801/2014(H3N2), A/Michigan/45/2015(H1N1)pdm09, and B/Brisbane/60/2008. The tetravalent vaccine also contains strain B/Phuket/3073/2013.
A/Hong Kong/4801/2014(H3N2) means the 4801th identified in Hong Kong in 2014 strain of the virus type A(H3N2). The strains in the vaccine do not change every year, three of these four strains have not changed since last season.
points.title: CDC Pinkbook Influenza

points.digest:
A vaccine virus is grown in fertilized chicken eggs Some vaccines [are grown==https://www.cdc.gov/flu/protect/vaccine/cell-based.htm] on the kidney cells of dogs. Thiomersal (mercurial preservative) are no longer used in children's vaccinations, but in the vaccine against influenza it was left (in multi-dose ampoules).The vaccine usually also contains polysorbate 80.
Twice a year WHO decides which strains to include in the vaccine.Select those strains that are good [multiply==https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/rr58e0724a1.htm] in the eggs.In the growing process, the viruses [mutated==http://mbio.asm.org/content/8/3/e00669-17], so the WHO-selected strain does not always match the vaccine strain.
About one dose [prodiced==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4514247/] of approximately one dose A vaccine maker uses a million fertilized eggs a day.

points.title: Low 2016/17 season vaccine efficacy against hospitalized influenza A(H3N2) among elderly: awareness warranted for 2017/18 season.
points.digest: The effectiveness of the vaccine against A(H3N2) in the 2016/17 season among hospitalized elderly was 17%. Among those who were vaccinated also in the previous season, the effectiveness of the vaccine was -2% (negative). The authors expect, as in the next season it will not be particularly effective, since strain A(H3N2) in the vaccine of 2017/18 remained the same.
This explains why the vaccine in 2016/17 was ineffective (because the virus is grown in eggs and mutates).
points.title: Contemporary H3N2 influenza viruses have a glycosylation site that is antibodies to antibodies elicited by egg-adapted vaccine strains.

points.digest:
How is the effectiveness of the vaccine calculated? To whom is it convenient?
In the observational studies, which most, check all those hospitalized with ARI for infection with influenza viruses, but only check the infection with those strains that are in the vaccine. The effectiveness of the vaccine is calculated by the formula VE = 1-OR = 1 - Oi/Oni, where Oi is the ratio of vaccinated to the unvaccinated among the sick with influenza, and Oni is the ratio of vaccinated to unvaccinated among non-flu cases, and other ARI. Vaccines are usually measured only among or among those who are ill, which of course does not provide an adequate assessment of efficacy.In the previous study, for example, the median age of hospitalized patients was 80 years old, and 94% of them also had another disease that predisposes to ARI.
Because circulating strains flu every year change, and the flu vaccine every year is new, then its effectiveness can not be checked before the start of the flu season, and it is set only at the end of the season.

points.title: A Perfect Storm: Impact of Genomic Variation and Serial Vaccination on Low Influenza Vaccine Effectiveness During the 2014-2015 Season.
points.digest:
In the 2014/15 season, the effectiveness of A(H3N2) vaccine in Canada was 53% for those who were vaccinated only this year, among those who were vaccinated also in the previous season, the efficacy was negative -32%. those who were vaccinated for 3 consecutive years, the effectiveness was -54%.
On average, the efficiency was -17%.

The effectiveness of the vaccine against A(H3N2) in 2004-2013 was 65% for those who were vaccinated in the same season. Those who are vaccinated often have efficacy of 24%. Effectiveness from Type B influenza virus was 75% for those who have been vaccinated only this year, and 48% for those who are vaccinated frequently.

According to observational studies, vaccination against influenza reduces the death rate among the elderly by 50%. Vaccination coverage among the elderly rose from 15-20% in the 1970s to 65% in 2001. Paradoxically, the elderly during this period only increased.
Less than 10% of deaths in winter are associated with influenza, which means that observational studies significantly overestimate the benefits of vaccination.

points.digest: 75% of the deaths from influenza are 70 years of age or older, but there are no randomized studies that prove that vaccination of the elderly reduces mortality. Some studies show that the flu vaccine prevents mortality even before the start of the influenza season, which indicates a systematic selection error.Such low-quality research, however, continues to be published in prestigious medical journals.
points.title: Influenza vaccination and benefits: new insights, new opportunities.

points.digest:
Analysis of literature on the impact of vaccination of medical personnel on patients.
Research showing the widespread belief that vaccination of staff reduces morbidity and mortality of patients is very poor, and recommendations are biased.
There is no reliable evidence that the vaccination of the staff brings some benefit to the patients.It does not reduce the incidence, does not reduce the mortality rate and does not even increase vaccination coverage among patients. The author concludes that one should not force a medical Physicians should read this article in full, there is a lot of interesting things.
points.title: What, in Fact, Is the Evidence That Vaccinating Healthcare Workers against Seasonal Influenza Protects Their Patients? A Critical Review.

points.digest:
Four randomized studies on the impact of vaccination of medical personnel on patients are analyzed here: according to these studies, the vaccination of eight health workers saves one patient from death, which means that vaccination of physicians saves 687,000 lives a year in the US, that is more people than died during the epidemic of 1918. It explains how the authors of the research are playing with statistics in order to get these completely insane results, and conclude that even according to the most optimistic estimates, we need 6,000-32,000 doctors to prevent one death from influenza.
In addition, according to these studies, it turns out that 90% of people die from the flu without the presence of respiratory symptoms, and that vaccination saves more people from death than they get sick with the flu.
The authors conclude that compulsory vaccination of physicians is not supported by empirical data, and that the resources spent for vaccination may be directed to something more scientifically proven.
points.title: Influenza Vaccination of Healthcare Workers: Critical Analysis of the Evidence for Patient Benefit Underpinning Policies of Enforcement.

points.digest: Influenza on the warship, where 99% were vaccinated (25 cases out of 102 soldiers). The isolated strain coincided with the strain in the vaccine. All the cases were given to Tamiflu. Another outbreak of influenza among fully vaccinated soldiers: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3855413/], [[2]==https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/eid/article/7/3/01-7320_article].

For these 8 years, strain A(H3N2) has not been guessed 5 times, and the strains A (H1N1) and B did not guess four times.

points.digest:
A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of the economic benefits of influenza vaccination. In the first year of the study, the strain was not guessed, the vaccine was ineffective, vaccinated because of illness 45% more working days than unvaccinated, and doctors visited 378% more often.
In the second year the strain was guessed, and the unvaccinated people missed 32% more working days than those vaccinated, and doctors attended 47% more often.
In both seasons vaccination led to losses.In the season, when the strain was guessed, the loss was $11.17 per person, in the season when you do not have guessed, the loss was $31.4 per person.
authors conclude that vaccination is not economically feasible for healthy working people.

points.digest:
In this study, we decided to test how influenza vaccination affects collective immunity. The pupils were immunized at school with a weakened vaccine. The families of vaccinated pupils were less sick with ARI than the families of the unvaccinated, but, paradoxically, in families vaccinated significantly more cases of hospitalization.
There was no difference in the number of missed days in school between vaccinated and unvaccinated.

points.digest:
Vaccinated from the flu (2 consecutive seasons) exhale 6.3 times more viral particles than the unvaccinated.
It is also reported that sneezing is not an essential factor in the isolation of the virus, unlike cough. But without any cough virus particles are released by breathing.

points.digest: In vaccinated people who contracted the flu, the risk of hospitalization was the same as in unvaccinated patients, the authors conclude that these data do not support the hypothesis that vaccination softens the symptoms of influenza.

Assessment of temporally-related acute respiratory illness, the following influenza vaccination.
points.digest: Many people believe that influenza vaccination can cause flu, the authors conducted this study to prove that it is not so.They found that: 1) The incidence of influenza among vaccinated and unvaccinated did not differ. 2) The incidence of other respiratory diseases among vaccinated children was 71% higher than that of unvaccinated children.

Systematic review of Cochrane effectiveness of influenza vaccines for children (75 studies, 17 of them Russian).
For children older than two years, the effectiveness of live vaccine was 33%, and inactivated - 36%.
For children under the age of 2 years, the effectiveness of the vaccine is practically zero. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15056235/.]. There is no evidence that the vaccine influenza reduces mortality, hospitalization, serious complications or infectiousness of influenza. The authors were surprised to find only one study of the safety of an inactivated vaccine, born in 1976, which included 35 children.They believe that it is rather strange that the vaccine is recommended to all children, despite the almost complete absence of safety studies, but they found 10 safety studies for the live vaccine, but they could not analyze the data, because manufacturers refused to provide all information about side effects.
The authors note that all studies of vaccines were of poor quality.
points.title: Vaccines for preventing influenza in healthy children.

points.digest:
Systematic review of the Cochrane Effectiveness of Influenza vaccines for adults (90 studies.) Less than 10% of studies have been of high quality. Vaccination has a very modest effect. It is necessary to inject 40 people to prevent one case of ARVI, and 71 people to prevent one case of influenza, vaccination did not affect hospitalization for influenza, or for missing work days, 92 pregnant women should be vaccinated to prevent one case of ARVI in pregnant women and 27 women to prevent one case of flu in newborns.
There is no evidence that vaccination reduces the risk of serious complications
There are more than 200 viruses that can cause symptoms similar to the flu and that can not be distinguished without a laboratory check.The influenza A and B viruses represent approximately 10% all these viruses.
points.title: Vaccines for preventing influenza in healthy adults.

points.digest:
A systematic review of the Cochrane Effectiveness of influenza vaccines for the elderly (75 studies).
All studies were so substandard that the authors could not conclude anything.
[Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16213065] it is reported that in the elderly after vaccination produced 41-76% less antibodies than the young.
[Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26516142] it is reported that in the elderly who take statins, 38-67% less antibodies are produced than those who do not take them.
points.title: Vaccines for prevention of infection in the elderly.

points.digest: A systematic review of the Cochrane effectiveness of influenza vaccination against medical personnel who works with the elderly. There is no evidence that vaccination of health care providers reduces the number of influenza cases, the number of complications or mortality among the elderly.
points.title: Influenza vaccination for healthcare workers who care for people aged 60 or older living in long-term care institutions.

points.digest:
Systematic review of Cochrane 259 influenza vaccine trials.
70% of studies were substandard, and overly optimistic in their findings. Only in 18% of studies did the findings coincide with the results. Let that sink in. 82% of the findings did not coincide with the results.
In quality studies, the results and conclusions were agreed 16 times more often.
Qualitative studies 25 times less conclude that the vaccines are effective.
Studies funded by the government are 2 times less likely to conclude that vaccines are effective.
Research, Financing mye industry, more often published in prestigious journals (with a higher impact factor), regardless of the quality of research, or the number of participants.
points.title: Relation of study quality, concordance, take home message, funding, and impact in studies of influenza vaccines: systematic review.
Vaccination against human influenza A/H3N2 virus inhibited the induction of heterosubtypic immunity against lethal infection with avian influenza A/H5N1 virus.
points.digest:
Infection with the influenza A virus increases immunity from more dangerous strains. This is called [heterosubtypic immunity==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heterosubtypic_immunity.] Vaccination has the opposite effect. Mice vaccinated from seasonal influenza, and then infected with pandemic avian influenza, grafted mice died, and ungrafted survived.
The authors conclude that during the next influenza pandemic, the risk of serious complications and death in vaccinated children will be higher than that of unvaccinated. [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19879807].

A part of the mice were infected with the usual seasonal flu, and a month later all mice were infected with lethal avian influenza. The mice that had been ill with the usual flu almost all survived, and those who did not get sick all died. [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17005299], [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22643217].
points.title: Infection of mice with a human influenza A/H3N2 virus induces protective immunity against lethal infection with influenza A/H5N1 virus.

points.digest: Influenza in childhood protects against more dangerous strains of influenza in adulthood.
points.title: Potent protection against H5N1 and H7N9 influenza via childhood hemagglutinin imprinting.

points.digest: Since the influenza virus is constantly mutating, the immune system, reacting to it, is affected by the original antigenic sin.With a new strain of the virus, it produces antibodies to previous strains, due to antibodies to the new strain, which leads to an aggravation of the disease.
points.title: Original antigenic sin responses to influenza viruses.

points.digest:
The effectiveness of the vaccine does not decrease monotonously with the increase in the antigenic distance between the vaccine and the circulating strain.The minimum effectiveness of the vaccine is at some intermediate distance between the strains.As the vaccine efficiency at this intermediate antigenic distance between the vaccine and circulating strains is below the efficiency at a greater antigenic distance, the original antigenic sin can lead to the fact that the vaccinated will become more susceptible to the virus than the unvaccinated.
This phenomenon, it is possible, explains why in those years when the vaccine strain [not guessed==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11015795], the vaccine is not just useless, but on the contrary, only aggravates the course of the disease. strain guess less often than in 50% of cases.
points.title: Understanding Original Antigenic Sin in Influenza with a Dynamical System.

points.digest: Vaccination can significantly affect the mutation of the virus, and accelerate its evolution if it provides partial or imperfect immunity. This was demonstrated on chickens. Vaccinated from influenza, there were twice as many virus mutations as in unvaccinated chickens. br> The authors conclude that in seasons with high vaccine coverage, mutant strains of the virus should be expected, and monitoring beyond them should be strengthened.
points.title: Vaccination and antigenic drift in influenza.
Seasonal influenza vaccine and increased risk of pandemic A/H1N1 related illness: first detection of the association in British Columbia, Canada.
points.digest: Seasonal influenza vaccination increased the risk of swine flu infection by 2.5 times among children in Canada in 2009. These results were confirmed in five other studies. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/pmid/20386731/].

points.title: Randomized Controlled Ferret Study to Assess the Direct Impact of 2008-09 Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine on A (H1N1) pdm09 Disease Risk.

The grafted in the last season, soldiers fell ill with swine flu much more unvaccinated.

points.digest:
VAERS Analysis. In the 2009-10 season, when vaccinated with two flu vaccines (from conventional and from porcine), the risk of miscarriage was 11 times higher than in the 2008-9 season, and 6 times higher than in the 2010-11 season.
As a proof of the safety of a flu vaccine for pregnant women, two studies usually lead, 56 in the first, and 180 women in the second, in a thiomersal-free vaccine.The third study involved 2,291 women, but miscarriages were not included in the analysis.
It is believed that the vaccine leads to a miscarriage in 1.9 cases per million p However, these data do not take into account the fact that a negligible number of all side effects are registered in VAERS.
points.title: Comparison of VAERS fetal-loss reports during three consecutive influenza seasons.

points.digest: The flu vaccine leads to an inflammatory reaction in pregnant women.The inflammatory response from vaccination is much weaker than from an infectious disease, but nevertheless, it can increase the risk of negative consequences. In the 2008-9 season were vaccinated 11.3% of pregnant women, in the 2009-10 season, thanks to a pandemic, 50.7% of pregnant women from seasonal influenza and 47.7% of swine flu were vaccinated.
points.title: Inflammatory responses to trivalent influenza virus vaccine among pregnant women.

points.digest:
A study of 197 thousand children born in 2000-2010 Autism was diagnosed in 1.6% (1 of 63)
The vaccine against influenza during the first trimester of pregnancy increased the risk of autism by 20%.But after correction for multiple testing (Bonferroni amendment), the p-value becomes 0.1, and the authors conclude that with a probability of 10% this is only a random correlation.
points.title: Association Between Influenza Infection and Vaccination During Pregnancy and Risk of Autism Spectrum Disorder.

points.title: Guillain-Barré syndrome after vaccination in the United States: data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention/Food and Drug Administration Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (1990-2005).

points.digest:
The risk of narcolepsy in vaccines from swine flu in 2009 was increased 17 times. In [another==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4835303/] study the risk narcolepsy was increased 4 to 9 times. In the [third==http://www.bmj.com/content/346/bmj.f794] 14-16 times.
In a similar Swedish [study==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25325473/] it turned out that narcolepsy after this vaccine is much more often accompanied by psychiatric abnormalities.
points.title: Narcolepsy and hypersomnia in Norwegian children and young adults following the influenza A (H1N1) 2009 pandemic.
Inflammation-related effects of adjuvant influenza A vaccination on platelet activation and cardiac autonomic function.
points.digest: Vaccination against influenza conducts to platelet activation, and possibly increases the risk of cardiovascular disease.
A live influenza vaccine can, under certain conditions, mutate and become virulent.
points.title: Reversion of Cold-Adapted Live Attenuated Influenza Vaccine into a Pathogenic Virus.

points.digest:
Vaccination against influenza may lead sometimes to vasculitis. And to [neurological==http://www.scielo.br/scielo.php?script=sci_arttext&pid=S0004-282X2014000700496] complications.
[Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3944816/] it is reported that a live influenza vaccine significantly increases the colonization of pneumococcus and a golden streptococcus of the upper respiratory tract in mice. [Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4654764/] it is reported that a live influenza vaccine also increases the colonization of pneumococcus in the middle ear in mice, which may increase the likelihood of otitis.
[Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14985487] it is reported that the inactivated nasal vaccine, which was used in Switzerland, increased the risk of paralysis of the facial nerve 84 times.
points.title: ANCA-associated vasculitis, the following influenza vaccination: causal association or mere coincidence?
Are US flu death figures more PR than science?
points.digest:
The CDC claims that 36,000 Americans die of the flu every year, but they also include deaths from pneumonia in this statistics, which is not always the result of the flu.. Antacids, for example, increase the risk of pneumonia (hello, aluminum!), but they are not, for some reason, combined into one statistic.
According to the national statistics center (which is part of the CDC), an average of 1,348 people die from influenza.
Before 2003, the CDC claimed that the flu was dying 20,000 people a year.And then an article was published in JAMA, which raised this figure by 8 0% on the basis of the statistical model, despite the fact that in fact the death rate from influenza in the 90s was 30% lower than in the 80's.
In 2003 there was a low demand for the flu vaccine, the producers did not receive orders even in December, [Novak said==httpcrismcommunication.uga.edu/contributors/glen-nowak-ph-d/] from the CDC to NPR, so we decided that people should be encouraged to be vaccinated.

[== http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nvsr/nvsr60/nvsr60_04.pdf], for example, CDC data for 2014. 55,227 people died of influenza and pneumonia. only 4,605 ​​died of influenza and the rest from pneumonia, but not all of these 4,605 ​​really died of influenza because laboratory analysis of the virus is rare, but the CDC sums up deaths from laboratory-confirmed influenza (J09-J10), and from a suspected influenza (J11), although only a small amount of ARI is caused by influenza viruses.

But [presentation==http://iom.nationalacademies.org/~/media/E9B963EDB28645C5ABCC22467120662D.ashx], which was prepared by Dr. Novak, CDC's director of public relations, where he explains exactly how the media and medical experts must intimidate the population with the flu, and thus increase the vaccination coverage.It tells you, among other things, what the CDC thinks of you.I recommend that you read only 17 slides. Here is a quote: "Health literacy is a growing problem.".

points.title: Trends in Recorded Influenza Mortality: United States, 1900-2004.
points.digest:
Homeland Security expects that the next flu pandemic will kill 6-56 times more Americans than regular seasonal flu, WHO is more conservative, and expects the pandemic to kill 4 to 30 times more people than usual flu.
However, with the exception of 1918, each of the following pandemics was less lethal than previous ones, and mortality in influenza pandemics (1957/58, 1968/9) was not significantly different from that in normal influenza seasons.
NIH analyzed the data of 30 influenza seasons, and did not find a correlation between the increased vaccine coverage and the decline of mortality in any age group.
CDC claims that the death rate from influenza increased by 67% in the 90s, while in fact it fell by 38%.

points.title: Influenza vaccines: time for a rethink.
points.digest:
For most people, the influenza vaccine is useless, as most people do not get sick with the flu, only 7% of the ARI is caused by the flu virus. Quoted CDC studies are subject to the healthy user bias, that is, healthy people get vaccinated more often than patients.
Australia stopped the vaccination program in 2009 because it was found that one of the 110 children had febrile convulsions, suggesting that the safety of past influenza vaccines is indicative of the safety of future - unreasonably.

points.title: Influenza: marketing vaccine by marketing disease.
points.digest:
Promoting influenza vaccines is one of the most aggressive public health strategies today. 20 years ago, in 1990, the vaccine market for influenza in the United States was 32 million doses, and today it is 135 million doses. was caused not by demand, but by an advertising campaign that tells us that the flu is a serious illness, that we are all at risk of complications, that the vaccine is practically safe, and vaccination saves lives. From this point of view, it seems that the lack of vaccines for all 315 million citizen The United States borders on the unethical, yet people across the country are being vaccinated against influenza, especially in medical institutions, precisely because not everyone wants it, and coercion is the only way to achieve high vaccination coverage. In the 1960s CDC recommended the vaccine only for the elderly (65 and older), in 1984, medical personnel were also inoculated, and in 1987, those who lived in the same house with the elderly were added. In 1997, they began to vaccinate pregnant women in the 2nd and 3rd trimester. In 2000, they began to vaccinate those who are over 50. In 2004, they began to vaccinate pregnant women in the first trimester, children from 6 months to two years, as well as all those who contact them. In 2006, the recommendation extended to children under 5 years old, and all who contact them. In 2008, they began to vaccinate all children under the age of 18, and in 2010, the rest of the population, except for infants under 6 months.
The CDC, based on one observational study that it funded, claims that the influenza vaccine reduces mortality from all causes among the elderly by 48%. If this is true, then a flu vaccine can save more lives than any other medicine registered on the planet. If influenza is only responsible for 5% of winter mortality, then the vaccine against it can not prevent half of all deaths. If observational studies are impossible to believe, what evidence is there for reducing mortality among the elderly due to vaccination? Practically none. There was only one randomized study among the elderly, it was 20 years ago, and it did not show a decrease in mortality. That is, a flu vaccine is recommended despite a complete lack of clinical trials proving its effectiveness. The recommendation is based only on the development of antibodies, but there is no evidence that these antibodies lead to a reduction in morbidity. And since at the moment the vaccine is recommended to everyone, it is already unethical to conduct a randomized trial.

points.title: WHO and the pandemic flu "conspiracies".
points.digest:
In 1999, after the bird flu outbreak in Hong Kong, WHO began to prepare for a pandemic, and after 10 years, on June 11, 2009, Margaret Chan, WHO Director-General, proclaimed that the pandemic had finally come. The governments of different countries spent billions of dollars on the purchase of antiviral drugs - Tamiflu and Relenza - a year later, these reserves remain untouched, and states are breaking contracts with vaccine manufacturers.
Consultants who drafted recommendations for the WHO worked simultaneously on pharmaceuticals and their conflicts of interest were not disclosed, so the pharmaceutical companies recommended that states purchase WHO supplies of antiviral drugs through the WHO, because there will be a shortage of pandemic during the pandemic.
The composition of the emergency committee is kept secret by the WHO. Margaret Chan refused to provide a report about the conflicts of interests of those who make WHO recommendations for states.
Several months before the pandemic was declared, WHO changed the criteria by which a pandemic can be declared, and now for this there was no need to assess morbidity and mortality.
There was no scientific reason to conclude that 2 billion people will become ill with swine flu. Moreover, WHO did not change its assessment even after the influenza season in Australia and New Zealand, where only 1-2 people out of 1000 fell ill. Also there was very little data on the safety and efficacy of vaccines.
The FDA did not want to license Relenza, because it was not more effective than placebo. But in the end, she licensed to have something on the market in case of an influenza pandemic.
There are many interesting things in the article. BMJ, one of the leading medical journals, conducts an investigation and openly writes about total corruption and WHO. If you still have some doubts that WHO is a corrupt organization, this article will dispel them.

points.title: Influenza vaccination: policy versus evidence.
points.digest:
Systematic studies show that vaccination against influenza is practically useless.Most studies of poor quality, safety is almost not checked.It is urgently needed to review vaccination programs.
This is written by the head of the vaccines department in Cochrane.The one who believes that despite the lack of evidence, there is no need to continue to investigate the safety of aluminum. For such a freethinking from him [turned==https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2009/11/does-the-vaccine-matter/307723/] down a colleague, and at a conference on cooking to a pandemic he was forced to dine alone.

In 2002, the CDC began [to encourage==https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm5738a2.htm] vaccination of children from 6 months to 2 years of age, and in 2004 already In the first year, the child receives two doses of the vaccine.In 2009, children [received==https://www.cdc.gov/h1n1flu/vaccination/public/vaccination_qa_pub.htm] an additional vaccine against swine flu.
Here are cases of death of children under 5 years of age from influenza in 1996-2014.

In 2010, the recommendation was extended to all people over six months. Here is a graph of the deaths from influenza in all age groups in 1996-2014.
For the proportion, more than 3,000 people die every year from malnutrition, 7000 die from C.difficile, 40,000 from poisoning, 30,000 from alcohol, 50,000 from drugs, 40,000 from suicide, 80,000 from diabetes, 90,000 from Alzheimer's, and 200-400 thousand from medical [errors==http://www.bmj.com/content/353/bmj.i2139.full].

According to VAERS, since 2000, 835 people [died==http://www.medalerts.org/vaersdb/findfield.php?TABLE=ON&GROUP1=CAT&VAX=FLU(H1N1)&VAX=FLU3&VAX=FLU4&VAX=FLUA3&VAX=FLUC3&VAX=FLUC4&VAX=FLUN(H1N1)&VAX=FLUN3&VAX=FLUN4&VAX=FLUR3&VAX=FLUX&VAX=FLUX(H1N1)&VAX=H5N1&VAX_YEAR_LOW=2000] after the flu vaccination, and 2161 became disabled. Considering that only 1 -2% of serious side effects, it is possible that the flu vaccine killed more people than the flu itself.

points.title: Influenza vaccination and benefits: new insights, new opportunities.
points.digest: Despite the fact that according to observational studies, the flu vaccine reduces all-cause mortality by 50%, the increased coverage of vaccination did not lead to a reduction in mortality from either influenza or other causes.

points.title: Role of medical history in the brain tumour development. Results from the international adult brain tumour study.
points.digest: Those who had the flu and ARVI, the risk of glioma (brain tumors) and meningioma (tumors of the meninges) was 27-28% lower.

points.title: Antiviral medications for influenza.
points.digest:
Based on substandard and biased research, largely unpublished, antiviral drugs oseltamivir (Tamiflu) and zanamivir (Relenza) shorten the course of influenza by 0.6-0.7 days. They do not reduce the risk of pneumonia and hospitalization.
Sales of Tamiflu more than 18 billion dollars.Most of the sold stocks were not used.Preparations are not recommended if it has been more than 48 hours from the onset of symptoms.

points.title: Complications: tracking down the data on oseltamivir.
points.digest:
An interesting investigation by BMJ about how Cochrane tried to access data from clinical studies of Tamiflu. In 2009, a Japanese pediatrician asked Cochrane why their systematic review was based on unpublished manufacturer data, rather than on their own analysis Cochrane had to respond to this within six months, and for a long time tried to get the original data from the manufacturer, they never got it.
This led to the fact that Cochrane [decided==https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CU3PsTd5Bg0] to change its methodology for systematic reviews.

points.title: The Tamiflu fiasco and lessons learnt.
points.digest: Another interesting article about Tamiflu: As it turned out that despite the lack of scientific evidence of the effectiveness and safety of this drug, WHO, FDA, CDC and EMA (European FDA analogue) not only recommended it for treatment and prevention of influenza, but also recommended to store them in large quantities. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4973146/], [[2]==https://www. ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1914480/]. [Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22156085/] it is reported that the risk of death within 12 hours after taking Tamiflu 1.9 times higher than after taking Relenza, and the risk of deterioration 5.9 times higher.

points.title: The effect of the disease on antipyretics in the treatment of the infection: systematic review and meta-analysis.
points.digest:
A systematic review and meta-analysis of the use of antipyretic drugs (antipyretic drugs) during influenza on mortality. Randomized and placebo-controlled studies in humans have not been conducted, eight animal studies (mice and chickens) have been found.
Antipyretics (aspirin, paracetamol, diclofenac) increased the death rate by 34% during influenza.
Paracetamol and ibuprofen are recommended for children and adults as antipyretic during influenza, despite the lack of scientific evidence of their effectiveness and safety. There is evidence that a fever during a disease increases the chances of survival, and that the use of antipyretics may have an adverse effect on the course of the disease Antipyretics increase the risk of death in mammals with various bacterial, viral and parasitic diseases.
There are also evidences of negative influence antipyretics for bacterial pneumonia (possible complication of influenza) in animals, which can complicate the flu even more. Like the influenza virus, many strains of pneumococcus are sensitive to temperature, and die at 40-41°C. The use of aspirin in pneumococcal infection increased mice mortality by 2-3 times.

points.title: Oral administration of Lactobacillus gasseri SBT2055 is effective for preventing influenza in mice.
points.digest: The probiotic protects mice from the flu. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28931041], [[2]==https://www. ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28416546], [[3]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5104466/], [[4]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25765832], [[5]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3899257/], [[6]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24329975]. [Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29077061] it is reported that probiotics significantly increase seroconversion of the vaccine.

points.title: Effects of probiotic Lactobacillus brevis KB290 on incidence of influenza infection among schoolchildren: an open-label pilot study.
points.digest: Probiotic protects against influenza and children, too.

points.title: Probiotic effects on cold and influenza-like symptom incidence and duration in children.
points.digest: Probiotics reduce the incidence of cough in children by 41-62%, the common cold by 28-58%, high temperature by 53-72%. The use of antibiotics decreased by 68-84%, and missed days in the kindergarten at 27-31%.

points.title: Physical interventions to interrupt or reduce the spread of respiratory viruses.
points.digest: Systematic review of Cochrane.To reduce the spread of SARS should wash their hands and teach the children. Masks and gloves are also effective.

points.title: Garlic for the common cold.
points.digest: Systematic review of the effect of garlic on colds in the Cochrane The authors found only one suitable study in which garlic reduced the risk of the common cold by about 3 times.

points.title: Randomized study of the efficacy and safety of oral elderberry extract in the treatment of influenza A and B virus infections.
points.digest:
A small, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of treatment of influenza with elderberry extract. The elderberry extract shortened the disease 4 days compared with placebo. [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih. gov/pubmed/19682714], [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9395631], [[3]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih. gov/pmc/articles/PMC4848651/], [[4]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22972323].
For comparison, Tamiflu [shortens==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4396761/] illness for 17 hours, [promoting==http://www.cochrane.org/CD008965/ARI_regulatory-information-on-trials-of-oseltamivir-tamiflu-and-zanamivir-relenza-for-influenza-in-adults-and-children], with the risk of psychiatric complications and renal failure but, for some reason, the governments of all countries spend billions of dollars on the purchase of stocks of Tamiflu, and no one buys elder.

points.title: The effectiveness of vitamin C in preventing and relieving the symptoms of virus-induced respiratory infections.
points.digest: Megadoses of vitamin C (1g every hour for 6 hours, and then 3 times a day) reduce the symptoms of flu and colds by 85%.

points.title: Zinc Lozenges May Shorten the Duration of Colds: A Systematic Review.
points.digest:
Zinc, perhaps, also treats colds, but only in large enough doses.
Also anti-influenza effect have [ginseng==http://www.mdpi.com/2072-6643/6/2/517/htm], [green tea==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21832025], [propolis==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18610553] and [iodine==www.thyroidscience.com/reviews/derry/Derry.flu.iodine.9.19.09.pdf].

points.title: Influenza, solar radiation and vitamin D.
points.digest:
There are many hypotheses why respiratory diseases are only a problem in a certain season: cold, dry air, indoors, travel, solar ultraviolet radiation that kills pathogens, a yearly biorhythm of hormones, etc. Perhaps, that the seasonality of viruses and bacteria is responsible for this.
The authors analyzed the number of deaths from influenza and pneumonia in Norway in 1980-2000, and compared with the level of ultraviolet radiation and the vitamin D. Disease from influenza 2 months after reaching the minimum level of vitamin D, but this is probably due to the fact that the disease usually begins several weeks before death.
The maximum level of vitamin D is observed in mid-summer, and the minimum in February.
In women who avoid direct sunlight, the level of vitamin D is 25 nmol/L.
Norway is at 58-70 degrees of latitude, and vitamin D is synthesized on the skin only in the summer.
In the tropics the seasonality of the flu is not observed, but from 20-30 degrees latitude is already observed. At first glance this is unexpected, but at the 25th latitude in the end of June, 5 times more vitamin D is synthesized on the skin than at the end of December. It is known that vitamin D strengthens the immune system.

points.title: Epidemic influenza and vitamin D.
points.digest:
Most vitamin D is produced by the sun.
In the middle latitudes, many people have low levels of vitamin D, especially in the winter.
Elderly people produce four times less vitamin D than the 20-year-olds, under the influence of the same solar radiation.
In London (52nd latitude), vitamin D is not produced from October to March, as all UVB radiation is filtered by the ozone layer.The winter mortality in the UK is inversely proportional to the amount of sunlight.Each additional hour of the sun reduces mortality by 2.9%.
In vaccinated with live vaccine in February, the temperature rises 2 times more often than in vaccinated in June.In vaccinated in summer less antibodies are formed, 40% of those vaccinated in December secrete the virus, compared to 16% of those vaccinated in September.
There was no evidence of toxicity of vitamin D, even in the amount of 50,000 IU daily for 6 weeks, a single dose of 600,000 IU intramuscularly is also not toxic.

points.title: Randomized trial of vitamin D supplementation to prevent seasonal influenza A in schoolchildren.
points.digest: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of the effect of vitamin D on the incidence of influenza. Children who received 1200 IU of vitamin D3 a day had 42% less flu.

points.title: Vitamin D for the prevention of respiratory tract infections: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
points.digest: Systematic review and meta-analysis of the effect of vitamin D on the incidence of acute respiratory disease. Only randomized placebo-controlled trials are included.5 Vitamin D is associated with a 42% reduction in the incidence of children and 35% in adults.

points.title: Vitamin D and Respiratory Tract Infections: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials.
points.digest: A similar systematic review and meta-analysis (11 studies): Vitamin D is associated with a 36% reduction in the risk of ARI, small daily doses are associated with a 49% reduction in the risk of ARI, while infrequent high doses of vitamin A are less effective and reduce risk ARV only by 14%.

points.title: Vitamin D, innate immunity and outcomes in community acquired pneumonia.
points.digest: Among patients admitted to the hospital with pneumonia, mortality in those who had a vitamin D deficiency (less than 30 nmol/L) was 12.7 times higher than among those who had a vitamin level higher than 50 nmol/L.

points.title: Association of subclinical vitamin D deficiency in newborns with lower respiratory infection and their mothers.
points.digest:
The level of vitamin D in newborns hospitalized with acute respiratory infection was significantly lower than in healthy newborns (9.12 vs 16.33 ng/mL).
The level of vitamin D in mothers of hospitalized newborns was also lower than in mothers of healthy babies (13.38 vs 22.79 ng/mL). A high correlation was observed between the level of vitamin D in newborns and their mothers.

points.title: Cord-blood 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels and risk of respiratory infection, wheezing, and asthma.
points.digest:
The authors measured the level of vitamin D in the umbilical cord in 922 newborns.
In the next 3 months after birth, the risk of respiratory infections and other infections in infants with a vitamin level below 25 nmol/L was 2 times higher, than in infants with a vitamin level above 75 nmol/L. The risk of wheezing in children with low vitamin D at birth was 2-fold higher to five years of age than in infants with high levels of vitamin.

points.title: Cord blood vitamin D deficiency is associated with respiratory syncytial virus bronchiolitis.
points.digest: Infants, with a vitamin D level in the umbilical cord below 50 nmol/L, had bronchiolitis in their first year of life 6.2 times more often than those who had a vitamin level at birth above 75 nmol/L. Western countries, 40% of pregnant women and 50% of newborns have vitamin D deficiency. Vitamin D deficiency during pregnancy is associated with type 1 diabetes, multiple sclerosis, schizophrenia and respiratory diseases in children.

points.title: Association of subclinical vitamin D deficiency with severe lower respiratory infection in Indian children under 5 y.
points.digest: Children with a vitamin D level above 22.5 nmol/L suffered from pneumonia 91% less frequently. Exceptional GV over the course of 4 months reduced the risk of pneumonia by 58%.

points.title: Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D, mortality, and incident cardiovascular disease, respiratory disease, cancers, and fractures: a 13-y prospective population study.
points.digest: A prospective study of 14,000 people in the UK, followed by 13 years. The higher the vitamin D level, the lower the mortality rate, among those with a vitamin D level above 90 nmol/L, mortality was 34% lower than in people with a vitamin level of 30 nmol/L and lower, the risk of cardiovascular death was 38% lower, cancer 15% lower, respiratory disease 78% lower.

points.title: An association of serum vitamin D concentrations <40 nmol/L with acute respiratory tract infection in young Finnish men.
points.digest: Soldiers with low vitamin D levels (below 40 nmol/L) were 63% more likely to have respiratory illnesses than soldiers with a vitamin level higher than 40 nmol/L. Among those who smoked, the vitamin D level was lower than In non-smokers, soldiers who exercise more than 5 hours a week, the level of vitamin D was higher.

points.title: Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin d and the incidence of acute viral respiratory tract infections in healthy adults.
points.digest: Adults with a vitamin D level above 38 ng/mL were ill 2.7 times less likely to have a disease duration of 4.9 times less. The influenza vaccine did not affect the incidence.
There are several studies on the relationship of vitamin D to influenza and other ARI:

points.title: On the epidemiology of influenza.
points.digest: A very interesting survey article on the epidemiology of influenza and vitamin D, it is worth reading in full. Among other things, it turns out that in numerous laboratory experiments and could not prove that a person with flu can infect a healthy person.

points.title: Vitamin D: a new anti-infective agent?
points.digest: Low level of vitamin D also correlates with intestinal infections, pneumonia, otitis media, clostridial infections, vaginosis, urinary tract infections, sepsis, dengue, hepatitis B, hepatitis C and HIV. Vitamin D is used in the treatment of osteoporosis, rheumatism and cancer Before the middle of the 20th century, tuberculosis was treated in sun baths in sanatoriums, and it was treated with fish oil, these different methods of treatment have one common component - vitamin D.

points.title: Vitamin D for influenza.
points.digest: Tamiflu and Relenza are useless drugs that do more harm than good. I have seen how patients in nursing homes and staff begin because of them vomiting, diarrhea, hallucinations, delirium, and worsening cognitive function. The IOM recommends taking 600 IU vitamin D for those under 70 years old to reach the level of 50 nmol/L in 97.5% of people. However, their recommendation contains a statistical error, and in fact, you need to take 8800 IU to achieve this For several years, as I and my colleague have given vitamin D to patients, and most of them have a vitamin level of more than 100 nmol/L. We rarely see patients with influenza or ARD, and when we see, we give them shock doses of vitamin D (a one-time dose of 50,000 IU, or 10,000 IU three times a day for 2-3 days) Symptoms completely pass for 48-72 hours Vitamin D costs a penny for 1000 IU, that is, this treatment costs less dollar.

points.title: Pandemic preparedness for swine flu in the United States.
points.digest: Some health professionals may not want to be vaccinated against swine flu because the vaccine contains a mercury preservative thiomersal that can be harmful to health.It should check the level of vitamin D and make up for the deficit if necessary. the level of vitamin D is 50-75 ng/mL, and the optimal dose for adults is 4000-5000 IU per day.

It follows from these statistics that there is a correlation between the level of vitamin D in the plasma and the incidence, which does not in any way imply that the intake of vitamin D is justified, useful or safe, in the sun it is useful.
- With vitamin D here is meant D3.Care carefully to the choice of the drug, not all of them are equally safe.And it is best not to use additives at all, but simply to go to the sun.
- Personally, I tend to believe that a preventive vitamin D intake is probably a good idea for an adult but I'm not yet sure that this is a good idea for children, and even more so for babies.
Articles of Weston A Price about vitamin D: [[1]==https://www.westonaprice.org/health-topics/abcs-of-nutrition/from-seafood-to-sunshine-a-new-understanding-of-vitamin-d-safety/], [[2]==https://www.westonaprice.org/health-topics/abcs-of-nutrition/update-on-vitamins-a-and-d/]. It is written that too high a level of vitamin D increases the risk of heart disease and osteoporosis.

Influenza virus is transmitted mainly at close contact (less than 1 meter), the virus lasts the longest time on stainless steel (several hours), and on rough surfaces it survives less than 15 minutes. It is inactivated by 99% with hydrogen peroxide vapor (10 ppm) for 2.5 minutes.

points.digest: Influenza A(H3N2) virus [charged==https://www.facebook.com/7newssydney/videos/1826057830751675/] in the deaths of hundreds of elderly Australians in 2017. [Begin==https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT03049488] regular clinical trials of the long-awaited vaccine from [RSV==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_respiratory_syncytial_virus]. Volunteers are sought.

Aluminum was added to the current vaccine, and the researchers hope that it will be safer and more effective.

It is believed that the influenza virus is responsible for the pandemic of 1918. This, however, is far from fact. title: Polio

epigraph.text: The only safe vaccine is one that is never used.
epigraph.source: Dr. James Shannon, director of the NIH

points.digest: Despite the fact that poliomyelitis in developed countries has not been observed for decades, it, for some reason, continues to inspire horror.

Poliovirus is one of the many enteroviruses (intestinal viruses), and, like most of them, spreads by the fecal-oral route.
There are three different serotypes of the poliovirus (P1, P2, P3).
There are two types of polio vaccines.
1) IPV - Inactivated (Salk vaccine) This vaccine is usually combined with diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, and often with hepatitis B and Hib, therefore contains aluminum.It is not known how long it gives immunity Contains embryonic bovine serum. (IPV was the world's first vaccine, a virus for the cat Ora was propagated in animal cells.)
2) OPV - Live oral (Sabine vaccine).
The virus for both vaccines is grown on the kidney cells of green monkeys, and contains embryonic bovine serum.Opv also contains polysorbate 80.
96% of cases of poliovirus infection are asymptomatic, or accompanied by minor symptoms that occur within a few days: 1-5% of cases are accompanied by aseptic meningitis, which occurs in 2-10 days. Sluggish paralysis occurs in less than 1% of infected children, and in most people it also completely passes.
The last case of wild poliomyelitis was registered in the US in 1979. The diagnosis of poliomyelitis during the epidemics of the 1950s was based on paralytic symptoms or analysis of cerebrospinal fluid.If the patient had flaccid paralysis, then a diagnosis was made of "paralytic poliomyelitis". And if the amount of lymphocytes in the cerebrospinal fluid was increased - it was "non-paralytic poliomyelitis." Today, it is known that such a laboratory diagnosis is typical of viral meningitis, but this by no means indicates poliomyelitis. Only when epidemics have already begun to decline have begun to be checked for availability which led to the overdiagnosis of poliomyelitis during epidemics. Any kind of paralysis - peripheral neuropathy, stroke, cerebral or spinal tumor, multiple sclerosis, hysterical paralysis and many other diseases could be diagnosed as poliomyelitis. After the diagnosis of poliomyelitis was made, from it was difficult to refuse because of generous financial assistance to the victims of poliomyelitis, which was not available to patients with other types of paralysis.
Paralysis happened more often in people who were tired of physical activity ty, those who have recently removed tonsils, and those who had recently been vaccinated. In recently vaccinated paralysis usually began at the site of the injection. For the treatment of poliomyelitis, many drugs have been used, including strychnine, curare, cobra venom and various antibiotics. The effectiveness of these drugs was based on anecdotal information, but was offered with confidence. One of the frequent treatments was the irradiation of muscles and the spinal cord. In the 20th century, with acute poliomyelitis, gypsum and [buses==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splint_(medicine)] began to be applied. Paralyzed patients lay in plaster for months, leading to atrophy of the muscles, which were no longer paralyzed. The symptoms in plastered patients were often only exacerbated.
In 1940, an Australian nurse who was called [Sister Canny==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Kenny] came to the US and promoted more active polio treatment. Her ideas were rejected by the medical community in England and in Australia.
Many patients were most not prevented by the disease itself, but by isolation from family and friends. They felt abandoned. Fear of poliomyelitis caused even medical personnel to avoid patients.
Newspapers of those times documented fear and mass hysteria. Poliomyelitis was a sword of Damocles, carried over every child and adult. One of the newspapers in 1948 wrote that because of the epidemic the whole city should be closed, and children should not leave the house. The whole city was sprayed with DDT, and each family was advised to spray their house abundantly.
The history of poliomyelitis covered the whole country, and often also medical personnel. During the epidemic in Los Angeles in the summer of 1938, 198 hospital workers became ill (16% of female nurses). They had almost no temperature, no weakness, no abnormalities in the cerebrospinal fluid. Subsequently, this epidemic turned out to be mass hysteria, not poliomyelitis.

points.title: Intramuscular injections within 30 days of immunization with oral poliovirus vaccine - a risk factor for vaccine-associated paralytic poliomyelitis.
points.digest:
Between 1970 and 1984, Romania participated in tests of the safety of oral vaccine under the auspices of WHO, it turned out that in Romania, for some reason, 5-17 times more cases of vaccine-associated poliomyelitis (VAPP) are registered than in 12 other countries At first thought that in Romania the vaccine was too virulent, but in 1990 it was replaced with another vaccine, but the frequency of VAPP did not change.
There were 31 such cases among children from 1988 to 1992. Of these, 18 had a vaccination paralysis, and 13 got infected from vaccinated. They were compared to non-paralyzed children. It turned out that 87% of paralyzed children received intramuscular injections 30 days before the onset of paralysis (an average of 16.8 injections each), compared with 51% of non-paralyzed children (an average of 2.8 injections each). Each injection increased the risk of paralysis by 13%. In those who received one injection, paralysis was observed 8 times more often than those who did not receive injections, and those who received more than 10 injections, paralysis was observed 182 times more often. Penicillin injections increased the risk of paralysis by 62 times, injections of other antibiotics 40 times, and the DTP shot increased the risk of paralysis by a factor of 3.
86% of cases of VAPP were caused by injections. If children were not injected 30 days after OPV, the average number of cases of VAPP would not be 10.3 per year (1: 178 thousand), but 1.4 per year (1: 1.3 million).

points.title: Polio eradication in India: some observations.
points.digest:
The global eradication of poliovirus was to be completed by 2000, but this goal shifted first to 2002 and then to 2005. Despite concerted efforts, poliovirus in India could not be eradicated. Perhaps, instead of again and again shift the deadline for eradication, it's time to stop and think about why this goal is not achieved.We believe that it has four reasons.
1) The ineffectiveness of a live vaccine.Already in the 1960s it was known that in countries with warm climates OPV is less effective.In Uganda in the early 70s, the seroconversion The appearance of antibodies in the blood of the vaccine was very low, and only improved when the oral horse antiserum was given along with the vaccine, which neutralized the inhibitors of the virus in the saliva of children. In 1989, 14% of children with paralytic poliomyelitis were vaccinated as at least three doses, and their number increased to 22% in 1994. In Rajasthan, the number of children with paralytic poliomyelitis after six or more doses of the vaccine was 25% in 1999, and 58% in 2000.
2) High incidence of vaccine-associated poliomyelitis.It is believed that h about VAPP usually occurs only after the first vaccine dose. However, in 1999, out of 181 cases of VAPP in only nine cases, it occurred after the first dose of the vaccine, 51 paralysis came from subsequent doses, and the remaining 121 only contacted with grafted.
3) Resistance to vaccination.Some parents believe that the vaccine leads to infertility. These fears are unscientific and ignorant. In addition, children receive countless doses of vaccine, and parents begin to doubt its effectiveness, and also, do the authorities know how many doses are needed for protection.
During the massive vaccination campaigns, very sick children are vaccinated as well. And when such a child dies, parents mistakenly believe that he died because of the vaccine, and this has a negative impact on the vaccination campaign.
Parents are aware of two facts: a) many children get poliomyelitis despite multiple doses of the vaccine, b) some children (4) Inaccessibility of inactivated vaccine. Although IPV is more expensive (OPV costs 10 cents, and IPV costs 10 dollars), many children became ill with polio, although more than 10 were immunized. times, so the issue of price becomes irrelevant. Moreover, children are given 5 doses of DTP, and they are going to inject the vaccine against hepatitis B, and no one is embarrassed by their high cost.
In the pre-vaccination era, paralytic poliomyelitis was mainly affected by children from wealthy families, possibly due to increased hygiene. Today they are sick mainly from children from poor families. If the rich really got sick because of hygiene, then in the future outbreaks, rich children will again become victims of paralytic poliomyelitis. Poliomyelitis can not be eradicated by the program used today, because the vaccine is ineffective, and in itself leads to paralysis.

The WHO program on eradicating poliomyelitis in India raises many ethical issues, here we will focus on two.
1) The balance between the risks and benefits of a polio eradication program.
Unlike inactivated vaccine, the live vaccine also generates collective immunity.As the vaccinated child isolates the virus, it also infects those with whom it contacts, that is, every vaccinated person continues to spread the vaccine further.
True, the virus mutates during the spread of vaccine strains, and according to a Japanese study, 69% of serotype 1 poliovirus mutations, 92% of serotype 2 mutations, and 55% of serotype 3 mutations turned out to be neurovirulent.
2)Informed consent.
In India, no one informs parents WHO's recommendations focus on the promotion of vaccination, but WHO does not mention informed consent anywhere.If it has long been known that vaccination can lead to paralysis, doctors in India are advised not to report this fact to the people and discuss it only in academic circles. When it turned out that the vaccine causes more cases of paralysis than previously thought, one of the founders of the Policies Eradication Committee stated: "We can dare to publish the true VAPP figures only if we have an alternative strategy for immediate implementation."
Of course, if the benefits of the eradication program clearly outweigh its harm, it may not be worth informing parents. But is this really so? To answer this question it is necessary to find out:
a) how many cases of poliomyelitis have been prevented due to vaccination? This question can not be answered. Of course, the number of cases of poliomyelitis in India fell from 13-38 thousand in the 80s, to 1,126 in 1999. However, this was mainly due to a change in the definition of the disease. Before 1990, every case of acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) was classified as polio, and then only cases caused by poliovirus were considered. In 1996 and in 1999, the definition of poliomyelitis changed again. However, the number of AFP cases over the years has not changed. Moreover, today the number of cases of poliomyelitis is understated, since far from always available stool analyzes. And cases of VAPP are not considered polio at all. In addition, many of them are erroneously classified as other diseases.
b) how many cases of paralytic poliomyelitis occurred despite adequate vaccination? In 1998-2003, 33-60% of all cases of paralysis were inoculated with four or more doses of the vaccine. C) How many cases of paralysis were caused by the vaccine? In the same years, there were 120-206 cases per year, but according to some estimates, they are about 300 per year.
Even if the benefit of eradicating the virus outweighs the concealment of information about the dangers of the vaccine, at least compensate parents if their children fall ill with VAPP , or if they become disabled, or die from polio despite being fully vaccinated.
points.title: Some ethical issues arising from polio eradication programs in India.
New strategies for the elimination of polio from India.
points.digest:
In the Indian states of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, children under the age of five received an average of 15 doses of vaccine. In other states of India, children received only 10 doses by age 5. Only 4% of children received less than three doses of the vaccine , of which 90% were below the age of 6 months, a high level of vaccination should have led to the elimination of the virus.
So, the authors tested the effectiveness of the vaccine and found that the effectiveness of each dose in these states is 9%.This is much lower than the estimated effectiveness vaccines in other states (21%). Low effective The trivalent vaccine, as well as the eradication of serotype 2, and the elimination of serotype 3 in most states of India, motivated the replacement of trivalent monovalent vaccine (serotype 1), but this may lead to outbreaks of poliovirus serotype 3.
[Here==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9328555] reported that 54% of children with paralytic poliomyelitis were vaccinated with at least three doses. (Pondicherry, India)
[Here==https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/Multiple-doses-of-pulse-polio-vaccine-irritate-people/articleshow/20104516.cms] write that educated and well-off parents are starting to get bored when their child had already received 32 doses of vaccine by the age of five.
[Here==http://indianexpress.com/article/india/in-ludhiana-child-dies-half-an-hour-after-getting-polio-vaccination-4855322/] tells of a year and a half-year-old boy in India, to which vaccinators came to the house a month ago (September 2017), and, despite the parents' protest, woke him up and gave him a vaccine. Half an hour later, foam came from his mouth and he died.
This, of course, happened accidentally after vaccination, as nothing happened with the remaining 375 thousand vaccinated children.
Thus the vaccines become absolutely safe. Since this is the first case of death after vaccination, in the medical literature, death from OPV is not described (in fact [described==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28648545]), and other children from the same the vaccines did not die, it means that the vaccine has nothing to do with it, and this is an accidental coincidence. After a while, when the next child dies in half an hour after vaccination, this will again be the first such case, which also will not be associated with vaccination.

points.title: Protective efficacy of a monovalent oral type 1 poliovirus vaccine: a case-control study.
points.digest:
Despite the coverage of more than 90% of vaccinations in children under the age of 5 in India and Egypt, the spread of poliovirus was not managed, which led to the eradication of poliomyelitis under serious threat, and in October 2004 it was decided to develop a new, more effective oral vaccine only for serotype 1. After an extraordinary effort, a new monovalent vaccine was licensed in April 2005 and was immediately tested in India and Egypt.The outbreak of poliomyelitis in India in 2006 revealed the clinical effectiveness of the new vaccine, and compared with the effectiveness of a conventional trivalent vaccine.
122,000 cases of acute flaccid paralysis were recorded, 4.7% of them were caused by serotype 1 poliovirus. The effectiveness of each dose of a monovalent vaccine was 30%, and the effectiveness of each dose of a conventional trivalent vaccine was 11%, which means that five doses of a monovalent vaccine will protect 78% of children.To achieve the same degree of protection, 14 doses of a trivalent vaccine are needed.
Most likely, the increased effectiveness of a monovalent vaccine compared to a trivalent vaccine is called the absence of interference between the three serotypes of the virus. Even balanced trivalent vaccine formulations lead to infection with vaccine serotype 2, which is why this serotype was probably eradicated in 1999.
(Wild serotype 2 although it was [eliminated==http://polioeradication.org/news-post/global-eradication-of-wild-poliovirus-type-2-declared/], but the vaccine strain of this serotype is quite epidemic.In August 2017, 33 children in Syria were [paralyzed==http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=57382] by this strain.)

points.title: Is disease eradication ethical?
points.digest:
Eradication of the disease differs from elimination, contraction and extinction. Elimination means that the disease does not appear more in a certain area. The reduction means that some cases will be recorded further.
The price of eradicating poliovirus in the remaining outbreaks is too high , and eradication is a rather controversial goal.Most cases of poliovirus infection are subclinical, and therefore not all cases can be reported.In countries like North Korea and Burma it is very difficult to monitor for or to gain access to the population to make sure that the poor are eliminated.The budget of poor countries is diverted from more pressing goals and is directed towards eliminating the last marginal cases. In other countries, the emergence of respect for the choice of patients has led to problems in eradicating such diseases as measles and Many people in the US, Canada and the UK are resistant to vaccination, but they are few, but enough to put the eradication into question. The genomes of smallpox and poliovirus are known, and everyone can recreate them. This undermines the desirability of eradication for each disease.

points.title: Do not drop current vaccine until we have new ones.
points.digest: We need to think about whether we should ever stop vaccination, even after the eradication of the poliovirus, because in a world under the threat of terrorism, one should remember that polioviruses can be synthesized quickly and cheaply.

points.title: Polio program: let us declare victory and move on.
points.digest:
It was hoped that after the eradication of poliomyelitis, vaccination could be abolished, but in 2002, the poliovirus was [synthesized==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1490301/] that making it impossible to eradicate it, therefore, the world vaccination will have to last forever.Organization of poor countries in the last 10 years to spend their scarce resources to achieve an unrealizable dream was unethical. Moreover, despite the fact that India has not had a year one case of poliomyelitis, there was a huge jump in cases of non-poliomyelitis acute (NPAFP), with 47,500 new cases registered in 2011. This is 12 times higher than expected.In the states of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, where polio is vaccinated almost every month, 25-35 times more cases of NPAFP are registered than in other countries, clinically, NPAFP does not differ from poliomyelitis, but it is twice as lethal.The number of cases of NPAFP is directly proportional to the number of doses received. Although these data were officially collected, no one investigated them. The principle of "do no harm" was broken.
From India's perspective, $ 2.5 billion spent on eradication might have been better spent on water, sanitation and routine vaccination. Then it would be possible to achieve control or elimination of poliovirus, as it happened in developed countries.
The authors believe that the huge bill of $8 billion spent on this program is a small price if the world learns to beware of such vertical programs in the future.

points.title: Polio Eradication in Pakistan: Call for Alliance.
points.digest:
In Pakistan, almost the last country where paralysis from wild poliovirus still sometimes happens, the mujahideen do not like vaccinations, and they distribute anti-vaccination conspiracy theories among a tribal population where 40,000 parents refuse to vaccinate children. They believe that the vaccine contains banned by Islam ingredients such as monkey fats and pig fat Many in Pakistan also believe that the vaccine leads to infertility More than 50 vaccinators, as well as 7 policemen guarding them, were killed in 2013 and 2014. This hostility Avit threatens Pakistan's efforts to eradicate poliomyelitis.
